Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: They make such a mean TaroCado smoothie it's insane. I drive halfway across the valley to get it. It's well worth it! The Star Wars mascot stuff also helps them score points

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Chewy's since it first opened, and I used to think this place was decent. A solid 3.5. It wasn't always the best, but it's conveniently located across from UNLV, and it did a good enough job of satisfying your boba cravings.  The last few times I've been here, though, I've noticed a steady downgrade in quality. There was a lot of hit and miss items on the menu beforehand, and the drinks were obviously made with powder. But now, even favorites that I have always ordered didn't taste very good. The almond milk teas and Hokkaido I ordered on my last three visits tasted like straight up water, and the boba was (gasp!) not chewy, but tough and hard and disappointing.   All those visits were at night, so maybe it's just the night shift that's slacking? Or the boba has been sitting too long? And on my last visit, I used a stamp card, so maybe I shouldn't complain because it was free.  I guess I just expected there would be better quality control and the loyalty card, would uh, reward you for your loyalty with something that doesn't taste like water.  Overall, I probably won't be back anytime soon. Considering the disappointing experiences, I'm in no rush to try and fill out another stamp card. Plus one star for the cute decor, but minus three for the terrible boba.

Reviews.Author: Brittney-Ashley
Reviews.Content: I got a strawberry milk tea w/ mini boba that tasted horrible and my boyfriend got a tarocado w/ mini boba which was good but the boba was hard.   So I came back in the store with my drink and told the cashier if I could buy another drink since I wasn't satisfied with mine. I ordered the second drink a tarocado w/ regular boba. The guy at the counter got our order wrong and put mini boba instead of regular. My boyfriend goes to the counter tells the guy  my order is wrong, could you fix it?  The other employee then tells us after we bought the drink we didn't have to buy another drink and that could of just switched the drinks out. We asked for the refund and he said he couldn't bc it's already in the system and he didn't want to remake the drink? This place needs to work on communicating and customer service.

Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: I was not a bob fan before but the boba her is soo fresh and the drinks are so bomb !!!

Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: This is a hip little boba spot located fairly close to the strip.   I stopped by with the gf after grabbing lunch and was greeted by two super friendly workers. They were eager to help us with our drink selection and they were pretty cool. There was plenty of seating available for patrons and it was ACed/cooled.   We ordered the jasmine milk tea with boba and it was just perfect. Not too sweet and the tea flavor was decently strong. Boba texture was good too. I will definitely stop by again if I am in the area.

Reviews.Author: Elaine
Reviews.Content: Okay so it'll be my daily ritual to come here during breaks and after class because this booba place is excellent...I truly love the sea salt cream and goes so well with the green tea. Try it with egg custard and it's delicious ! I can't wait for them to restock with the hokkaido milk tea. Apparently it's so popular that they sold out...Eyes peered for it. Please go here, they have MACARONS and delicious drinks .

Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: Im liking this place now! I tried something new, the sea salt green tea. It is seriously the best drink ever. Their boba is now a lot chewier and softer which is really good! The service is still on point and the location is great since its near unlv. whenever I'm in the neighborhood, ill always go to this place!

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Thanks for making the tiger tea for me! Went in craving this drink and although they didn't know what it was, made it pretty quickly for me with a few instructions

Reviews.Author: Nikiya
Reviews.Content: I like the concept of this place. Modern art and feel to the place. Make sure you ask for no high fructose corn syrup when order because that's bad for you! I noticed it was sweet and asked what they put in it for sweetness so next time I asked for it without the fructose. I can't help but get a different flavor macaroon when I go. I like the avocado coconut smoothie- great combo.

Reviews.Author: Cy
Reviews.Content: This place is becoming my favorite boba place. I love the variety of tea/slush drink they have on the menu. I love how they make my personal favorite  Thai tea .  And the Macarons are tasty as well! I say this joint is fresh to death. And Don't forget to check in! free upgrade!! yeeeee!!!

Reviews.Author: Trang
Reviews.Content: I ordered a Sea Salt Green Tea with 1/2 mini boba and 1/2 regular boba.  The boba were both chewy and just right. You could actually play around with the mini boba lol. They gave you a lot of sea salt creme on top. However, its kinda sweet for me so I would definitely ask for less sweet next time. Also, i don't really feel the taste of green tea in it, not sure if they made it from real brew tea, and it's more like a regular milk tea. I would come back and try another drink thou.

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Great new boba joint!   What I notice right off the back is the unique graffiti art on the wall. Very modern layout and design (furnitures are all custom made). Good selection of drinks from slush, tea and smoothie! Will definitely be back for more of that good good!   FYI: Tarocado (avacodo and taro) is so bomb!

Reviews.Author: Alissha
Reviews.Content: While we were on vacation in Las Vegas we were lucky enough to find this boba spot. What we thought would be just a one day thing turned into an every day occurrence that we were there. We went there every morning to start our day and were able to try many different flavors. Staff was super friendly and super helpful. And ever since we left we feel lost without it.  The TAROCADO what's my favorite.  And their macaroons were to die for. I definitely recommend trying this Boba spot out there fairly new but super good. Now it seems like all we could talk about is our next trip to Las Vegas to get some Chewy!!

Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: So far, I've tried the thai tea and the milk tea.  I have also tried the pumpkin spice macaroon as well as the nutella macaroon. Both are great and are around $2 each. The boba and macaroons are delicious and pretty inexpensive. It's really convenient to have a boba place right across campus as I hate making the commute to china town. Overall, Chewy has a nice interior ( I may start hanging out here in between classes) and a friendly staff. I'll definitely be addicted to this place.

Reviews.Author: Aurora
Reviews.Content: This place is super simple, super fast. I like it because their menu is simply laid out and you're not inundated with millions of options and combinations like other boba places. I went in there once and there was about 15 people in there- probably a UNLV student group from the looks of it. Still, my order was super fast and came out in less than 3-5 minutes. (There weren't 15 orders ahead of me, just a handful, but it was busy.)  I have tried the Raspberry tea and Thai Tea flavors so far - yummy!

Reviews.Author: Shar
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the friendliest boba shop I've ever been to. The boba was so good that my family frequented this shop twice in as many days. We only wish that we could've stayed in Vegas longer for vacation...or rather, to drink more bubble tea!

Reviews.Author: Mayci
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, LOVE! Staff is always kind, polite and helpful. I've tried a couple different drinks and have never been disappointed. It's always clean, modern and trendy. Parking isn't the best but it's just a busy shopping/restaurant area. I normally get a flavored ice tea, or the Hawaiian Sunset - never disappoints!

Reviews.Author: Kei
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty ok! The service is friendly and they have a wide selection of teas and other drinks.   What made it a three was the actual drinks themselves. The milk teas themselves had tasty flavor (the texture was smooth) but the boba was really hard. I was expecting chewy boba because of the name but ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ The taste of the boba was good though.   Another part of the three stars was because even though it wasn't busy, the tables and chairs were dirty. My pants ended up getting gross on the butt because I sat in something sticky.   Maybe I'll try it again one day if I'm in the area.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: WOW love this place!  clean establishment, friendly staff, GREAT boba selection - kids loved it too!

Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: This cool spot is located next to UNLV. They do live up to their name of chewy boba Becuase the texture is pretty chewy and made just right. I ordered the Oreo cookies and cream slush which was put with the right amount of powder and not watered down.   They also have a variety of macaroon flavors. The flavors were just good and decent. Will try some other flavors they, offer they sound really good.

Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: Chewy Boba company is a franchise with a location across from UNLV. I stopped in after getting take out from Braddahs next door. They have a wide variety of milk teas and smoothies that you can add boba or a variety of other drink-add ins to like jellies.  I picked up a boba milk tea and a Thai tea. Both were really good and prices are typical to a like establishment. The drinks didn't have anything making it unique or better from other boba places around China town but that doesn't mean I didn't enjoy my drink.   They also offer macaroons for $2.25 each but a quarter is taken off each if you buy a dozen. They did look beautiful and offer many unique flavors like pumpkin spice. I didn't try any but the fact that they're not made in store and run the risk of dryness turns me away.  My drink was made quickly and the cashier was nice.  The shop is cute, clean, bright, and has plenty of seating.

Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: According to Yelp this place is  Hot and New  so I stopped by to check it out. It didn't disappoint. It's a great spot for boba and unique teas. The drink menu was expansive but the way it was categorized made it easy to order exactly what I wanted. Great addition to the UNLV area.

Reviews.Author: Morgan
Reviews.Content: What a great find! The girl behind the counter is super helpful and friendly and the tea and boba are delicious. Their starred flavours are definitely the  most popular  for good reason and she'll let you sample them if you ask.   Tons of options for both tea flavours and toppings and wonderful service. Maybe not the fastest service since there's only the one girl working, but definitely worth the wait and you can enjoy looking at their wall art and T-shirts.

Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: Good selection of tea flavors and they are willing to customize the drinks. Tasty green tea sea salt milk made just right. Descent prices and they have a stamp/loyalty card.

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: My anticipation for this place to open felt like an eternity. Originally, set to open in the fall, Chewy Boba Company has only been open for less than a month. I can honestly say that Chewy Boba Company is tied for the #2 spot on my favorite boba places in town!  Whatever you do, do not underestimate the macarons here because it is primarily a boba shop and they are not made in house.  The macarons are provided by the popular Macaron Cafe in NYC.  At $2.25 a piece or 6 for $12, I would probably get 6 next time. The macarons were made well, chewy, but good. The fillings were awesome and the overall taste is superb. The quality actually surpassed Bottega Louie in DTLA. What?! Shocker right? The creme brûlée macaron was my favorite of the two I ordered. The creamy filling was divine and I enjoyed the bits of caramelized sugar. The candy apple macaron had an good overall apple flavor, but nothing really stood out.   Straight up, tea and milk teas are not this boba shop's forte. They do offer unique drinks and flavor combos that you do not normally see at other boba shops.  This is the only other place in town, besides TapEx to offer mini boba and it's damn good here.   Tarocado - a must try. A perfect blend of taro and avocado with each flavor still prominent and a super smooth consistency. At times, it is a bit sweet. I would recommend less sweet next time.   California dreaming - strawberry, mango, peach slushy.  Matcha green tea slush with red bean topping - reminded me of halo halo! The matcha flavor was good, but the red bean over powered this drink. For a topping, I expected the red bean to be mostly at the bottom, but it looked and tasted blended with the matcha green tea slush. I still prefer KFT's version.   Hazelnut milk tea - love this with mini boba. The only other place that has this combo is TapEx and I am glad that Chewy Boba Company offers this because their service is so much better!   The interior is wow! I love the accents of reclaimed wood, white walls, and graffiti art. Overall, very clean and modern.   I'll definitely be back to try more macarons and explore their drink menu.   *****Yelp 2016 100 review challenge***** 4/100

Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: I came here at 5:53 and asked if I can get the buy one get one 50% off deal which starts at 6:00. So I asked if I can just pay at 6:00 and they told me no. Why couldn't I just wait 7 minutes to pay for my drink?  I already started making your drinks, so you have to pay now.  I should have just completely cancelled my order.   I bought 8 drinks so that would have saved us some money.  Bad service.

Reviews.Author: Sharlene
Reviews.Content: Good boba place with lots of variety in drinks and flavors and it's the closest boba place to me. My favorite is the sea salt green tea and the sea salt coffee. The coffee tastes exactly like Lee's ice coffee and strong. They have a stamp card so your 10th drink is free. Definitely becoming a regular. Only downside is I don't like the boba the texture and consistency is just not for me and I am picky with my boba and no boba has appealed to me here in vegas.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I love that this is right across campus for me! It comes in handy for my rather frequent boba cravings. I haven't had the chance to try many flavors yet, but I will in the future. Mini boba is one of my favorite things now!

Reviews.Author: Dina
Reviews.Content: This place is alright. Customer service and drink was good. I ordered the lavender smoothie with boba. Thought I've had better boba elsewhere. I ordered the white chocolate macaron and that was delicious. Maybe I'll come back and order something different if I'm nearby.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: This is the best boba place I have been to!!! Every time I come to Vegas to visit, come to Chewy Boba with my little sisters and my brother. I highly recommend this boba place, the selection of popping pearls and jelly are worth making the trip for!!! I definitely like Chewy boba over Tapioca Express... Last time I went there the boba tea I got was not as good as I expected it to be :-/ I usually go to Tapioca express in San Diego California but if I had a Chewy boba... I would go with Chewy Boba Hai!

Reviews.Author: Stefany
Reviews.Content: Do you love boba? What about Star Wars? Come on down!  Don't get the connection? Come find out.  Chris V put this spot on my radar by saying this was the only place (so far) to offer both sea salt cream and mini boba- and they do both exceptionally well. I daresay I enjoyed their sea salt coffee better than that other spot in town!  Macarons are the only edible currently available outside of various beverages- shipped in and refrigerated, not made on site, haven't tried them myself to make a judgement but they're cute enough to mention.  I love the logo and product enough to be tempted to buy a company t-shirt on my first visit- you will be too!

Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: Lavender milk tea. The best. Boba is damn near perfect every time. Sea salt green tea is pretty damn good, though a little bitter (of course fairly common when brewing anyhow).

Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: The best boba venue not on Spring Mountain. Their taro boba is so good I say it's probably the best in Vegas. I really dig how it's by unlv so whenever I'm in the area I always try to get a fix. Chewy also has the stamp card game going so a certain number of drinks will eventually get you a free one.

Reviews.Author: Mindy
Reviews.Content: I came here for a fundraiser. I got the Almond Milk Tea, which is my standard for new boba places, with Honey Boba. My friend ordered the Chai Milk Tea with Boba. Both were overly sweet. The boba definitely lived up to Chewy Boba's name, albeit a tad too chewy. The boba to milk ratio was low. Definitely needs more boba, especially for a large!!! The service was quick. The decor is great, but with very little sitting room.  I'd only go here if it was convenient.

Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: Love this place! We live in North Las Vegas and find every excuse to stop in here. Been working through their milk tea menu (3 more to try).  My favorites so far (all with boba): chai milk tea, taro milk tea, wintermelon, sea salt coffee, Hokkaido milk tea, Okinawa milk tea, and hazelnut milk tea (add the egg custard with your boba).  The kids usually ask for a strawberry slush, and my husband will order a taro or green apple slush.   Service is fast and always friendly and helpful!    They have a great variety of slush, smoothies, and hot options in addition to a lengthy add-in menu.   They have a discount for UNLV students, a stamp card, and free upgrades with Yelp check-ins.   Definitely worth the stop every time you're nearby!

Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: I tried this new spot near UNLV, I really like the decor and the style of this boba joint. They have a wide variety of flavors of teas and slushed along with toppings. I got the mango lychee slush with honey boba. The slush was good but the boba was really hard. It must of been undercooked but it was one of the reasons I could not finish my drink. Other than that, it was good!

Reviews.Author: Belen
Reviews.Content: First time here and won't be the last. Now I kno where I need to come to get my boba fix whenever I'm in vegas.. establishment very neat and clean and a cool looking mural right when you enter.. and as for the drinks they were really good.  I had the taro milk tea and it was sweet and milky just how I like it. The service was great and not to expensive. I even walked out with a really awesome shirt!

Reviews.Author: Lia
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from unlv! I ordered a regular sized Thai tea, the taste was sweet and the boba had a nice consistency to it. They have a wide variety of boba flavors as well.

Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: Being from LA, I'm used to seeing a boba place on every corner. When I first moved & didn't see any big boba signs anywhere, I assumed I had lost it for good. When my friend told me there was boba in town, I was super stoked! Chewy is amazing! The staff is super nice & friendly. I'm a Thai tea addict & it definitely has satisfied my cravings. A wonderful taste of home every time I come here :)

Reviews.Author: Kathryn
Reviews.Content: The milk teas here are actual quality! I've only tried this place twice. The first time I ordered a regular hot milk tea with boba. This time, I tried a hot sea salt green tea with boba. Both milk teas are actually very good quality. Loved them both!  Loving that there's actually good boba right across the UNLV campus now. I've only been here off season when there are no classes so I'm not sure if this place gets busy during the semester but there's never anybody else there when I go in.   I'm totally coming back to get more milk tea or try more of their other menu options.

Reviews.Author: Moona
Reviews.Content: Awesome place. Best boba in Vegas... These guys can customize your drink to make it less sweet and use real milk... Just great!!

Reviews.Author: Makenzie
Reviews.Content: Amazing boba! I got a green apple smoothie and my husband got the Taro avocado drink. We both loved ours. Truly authentic.

Reviews.Author: Jessica Marie
Reviews.Content: So I came here w friends in between classes. We each ordered drinks for ourselves.  Lychee green tea w lychee jelly - 5/5 Lychee green tea is my friends all time favorite tea. Shes tried a lot of lychee green tea from other boba places, and She had to say that this is one of the best ones.   Thai tea w boba - 3.5/5  She really wished it was sweeter and that She had an option to adjust the sweetness. It was mentioned a couple of times, and she went to grab a new drink to have after.  Almond milk tea w boba - 5/5  this is my all time favorite tea flavor since the beginning and this place definitely gets it right. Tastes as good as No. 1 Boba, which was my to go place before.  Aesthetics - Instagram worthy, 5/5 for entertaining Star Wars geeks (me, included) and designs perfect for the audience directed which obviously is mostly UNLV students across the street. The graffiti looked cool and everything looking very clean.  Service - Service was ok. Friendly guy at the counter but no greeting in or out of the place.    TLDR; 4/5  pretty good experience, service was eh. But will most likely come back again. Great job for a starting business!

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Husband and I went in to grab some boba tea and it was delish! The guy working the counter was very friendly and helpful-- he gave me a sample of some of the jelly toppings before I chose what I wanted in my drink. The milk teas were great-- not too sweet or syrupy, but I think you can adjust your sweetness level if you'd like. We also got 6 macarons from the display case which were really good as well!

Reviews.Author: Mitzui
Reviews.Content: I got Avocado Smoothie and it's soo good. I also have it delivered using the new UberEATS app by Uber and you pay the same exact price.

Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: We popped in here after we ate next door at Braddah's, based on their recommendation! The store is small but clean, with quite quirky/funky decor and a cool montage on the wall.  We ordered the hazelnut tea with boba.  We all agreed that it was pretty good.  It's not the best that we've ever had but it was good.  Service was quick too.

Reviews.Author: Murdoc
Reviews.Content: Nice staff. Boba was ehhhhh. I ordered a Thai tea slush. Wasn't really that good. Order two macaroons, those were good. It's pretty expensive here though.  I came here on a recommendation and won't be back. I could try other flavors, but I think Thai tea and milk tea should be on point, they're like the staple of boba. If that isn't good I assume the rest to be lacking.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Heard from some of friends about this place and my boyfriends hates anything boba and chewy but I'm complete opposite. We decide to try something new beside the traditional Thai Tea and I must say the popping pearls and the different flavored are to die for.  Customer service is amazing and  would totally be back here again

Reviews.Author: Olga
Reviews.Content: Great new boba tea place! Clean, delicious and friendly service! I can't wait to go back for some more boba! I got Taro and it was amazing!

Reviews.Author: Floregine
Reviews.Content: Just went there today and tried the sea salt cream green tea and it was the bomb. Probably the most closest to the sea salt by 85 dregrees i've tried so far. It will be my fav boba place from now on. Great customer service and cozy environment as well. My boyfriend and his mom also tried the avocado & taro milk tea and they loved it. Would definitely recommend with friends and family.
